Derivatives must be credited to O Say Can You See, made available non-commercially, and distributed under the same terms. Requests for permission for commercial publication or other use should be emailed to the project team.

div1.p: The admonition addressed by the honorable Robert Bacon to the officers of the Congo Reform Association of Boston following my protest appear to have prodced an effect, because since then the United States press has stayd silent on the topic of the American note and the attitude of the Washington Cabinet about the recognition of the annexation of the Belgian Congo state.
I have the honor to transmit herewith some articles from journaua relating others to the issues concering the Congo.
You will find (in annex 1) two articles announcing the voyage project in our colony of S.A.R Mr. Prince Albert and contains very big praise to the address of the heir of Ecône
Your Excellence Mr. Davignon Minister of Foreign Affaires etc. etc. etc. Belgium

The annex B includes informtion that blocked in a lot of journals and after which the Presbyterian Church, which belongs to the Ro Morisson, changed the Ro S.H. Chester, Missionary, to request the Secretary of State to monitor by the American Consul in Boma the proceedings for defamation brought agianst Morrisson and Sheppard.

The Buffalo "Sunday News" that we are always very hostile published a self-said telegram to Anvers to express which rubber is in the middle of rappidly running dry in the Congo. He also claims that Negros are forced to commit themselves for 5 years to work in the recently discovered gold mines (Annexe C)
